page.title: 03RTUYTON XI TOWNS CHURCH
page.content: {Ruyton XI Towns Church}was built in 1140 so that means it is 845 years old.The graveyard is as old as the church. There are about 900 people in the parish. There are 40-50 people in the congregation. The church architecture is mostly Norman. The reredos shows S. John the Baptist to whom the church is dedicated. The existing registers of the church date from 1719 as the earlier ones were destroyed by fire. In 1860 a Methodist chapel was built for 180 sittings but has now been demolished. A Congregational chapel was built in 1883 with 250 sittings and this chapel is still in use today although the attendance is very small.
